title: The Premade That Gave Me Hope

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
I played a ranked game.
Usually play Soraka support.
Usually play aggressive cuz I thought that rejuvenation would help me back up during and after trades.
Usually don't think I would get ganked.
In hindsight, I probably should've expected it.
As their fiddlesticks ulted into our lane, with the enemy Alistar headbutting and chain-ccing me into a Caitlyn trap, I tilted.
It wasn't this sole event either.
Went to clear a ward cuz i pinked it.
A fiddlesticks ulted point blank from tribush.
Went to ward a bush.
Accidentally grazed the 'R' key.
But then the threeman premade consoled me.
They said it was all right.
That it was fine.
That they were all at that stage one time or another.
I knew it wasn't. For god's sake, I _accidentally ulted._
But they reassured me it was all right.
Not a single time during that game was a harsh word even directed at me, nor was it directed towards the other solo-er nor towards each other (i had asked previously if they were using a communication system like skype so i would know to follow if only a single one of them pinged).
I had literally just asked them to flame me.
I really needed it. I've been so used to being flamed by a team that I've practically been better at functioning with flamers than functioning with such an angelic premade.
We eventually won that game. I was able to soon turn my score around, from a 0-4-0 to a 1-6-16.
It may not look much, but the whole point that I was able to turn my score around just _that little much_ was nothing short of a miracle.
The best part---They honored me.
I told them I loved them and i wished them the best of luck their next coming games. But when i exited the post-game lobby, I found this little gem.
One honor from each of the premades.
One honor from each category.
Knowing that there are people, let alone premades, like that in this world gives me hope.

I think the major problem here is how individual people measure toxicity in chat.
Everyone has their own scale ranging from _**"i get tilted from someone mentioning me in chat"**_ to _**"sticks and stones may brake by bones buy names will never hurt me"**_.

#Consider the following:
Would you even know who's toxic to you, if you'd had everyone on mute for 100 games?
I doubt that if people were just limited to being toxic in chat, you'd not even realize someone might be shit talking you for this long.

If you already know where the conversation with a certain someone is going to take you, you just mute them and get on with it. If they were particularly feisty, you still mute them and also report them at the end, without listening their whining in chat. And don't forget to block them. I am not disputing there are no toxic people in League but it's much more bearable when you are not exposed to their shit.

I sense toxicity as soon as someone in chat goes "Champion name (Not always mine) Damn FEEDING 1/6!" 

I'll tell them to stop being salty, but if they don't... 

I can't be held responsible for the inner teemo in me that takes over that loves to feed off other people's salt... I'm relatively a very nice person, I help new people, create a toxic free enviroment... 

but when it comes to people who are relatively toxic, I secretly enjoy watching the world burn.
